SEARCH
Package org.marjoriekohn.diningreview.service

Class UserService

java.lang.Object
org.marjoriekohn.diningreview.service.UserService
@Service public class UserService extends Object
Manages operations related to User entities. This class offers methods for creating, reading, and updating users. It communicates with the UserRepository to access the database, acting as an intermediary between the controller layer and the repository layer, ensuring a separation of concerns. Additionally, it handles the conversion between User entities and UserDTOs.
See Also:

  • UserDTO
  • User

  • Constructor Details

    • UserService

      @Autowired public UserService(UserRepository userRepository)

  • Method Details

    • createUser

      @Transactional public void createUser(UserDTO userDTO)
      Registers a new user. This method processes a UserDTO, verifies if a user with an identical username exists, and if absent, persists the new user to the database. Subsequently, the saved user's details encapsulated in a UserDTO are returned.
      Parameters:
      userDTO - the Data Transfer Object encompassing user details., required
      Throws:
      DuplicateUserException - if a user with the given username already exists
      See Also:
      • UserRepository.findByUsername(String)
      • convertDTOToEntity(UserDTO)
      • convertEntityToDTO(User)

    • findByUsername

      public UserDTO findByUsername(String username)
      Retrieves details of a user based on their username. Fetches a user from the database using the provided username and, if found, returns the user's details inside a UserDTO.
      Parameters:
      username - the unique identifier for the user, required
      Returns:
      the located user's details within a UserDTO
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - if no user with the provided username exists
      See Also:
      • UserRepository.findByUsername(String)
      • convertEntityToDTO(User)

    • updateUser

      @Transactional public void updateUser(String username, UserDTO userDTO)
      Modifies an existing user's details. Takes a username and a UserDTO, retrieves the user from the database, updates their details based on the given UserDTO, and then persists the updated user.
      Parameters:
      username - the unique identifier for the user, required
      userDTO - the Data Transfer Object encompassing user details, required
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - if no user with the given username is found
      See Also:
      • UserRepository.findByUsername(String)
      • convertDTOToEntity(UserDTO)

    • convertEntityToDTO

      public UserDTO convertEntityToDTO(User user)
      Transforms a User entity into a UserDTO. This method takes a User entity as an input and converts its fields into a UserDTO, which is more suitable for client-side operations. It is especially useful when transmitting user details between the server and client.
      Parameters:
      user - the User entity fetched from the database, required
      Returns:
      a UserDTO containing the details of the given User entity
      See Also:
      • convertDTOToEntity(UserDTO)
      • User
      • UserDTO

    • convertDTOToEntity

      public User convertDTOToEntity(UserDTO userDTO)
      Transforms a UserDTO into a User entity. This method takes a UserDTO as an input and converts its fields into a User entity, making it suitable for database operations. This is particularly useful for persisting user details to the database.
      Parameters:
      userDTO - the Data Transfer Object containing user details from the client-side, required
      Returns:
      a user containing the details of the given UserDTO
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided UserDTO is invalid
      See Also:
      • convertEntityToDTO(User)
      • User
      • UserDTO
